summary: The "Words Matter Act of 2025" aims to amend various federal laws by replacing the terms "mentally retarded" and "mental retardation" with "intellectual disability" and "individuals with intellectual disabilities." The bill targets numerous sections of the United States Code and other acts relating to healthcare, social security, criminal justice, and other programs, ensuring consistent language usage across federal regulations and guidelines, without altering the underlying rights or responsibilities. This legislation also provides guidance for updating existing regulations.
